newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak shares mixed, SAX down 0.51 pts at 221.28.
newsitem.headline: Slovak shares mixed, SAX down 0.51 pts at 221.28.

text.p: Slovak leading shares were mixed in thinner trading on the Bratislava Stock Exchange on Monday, with the 12-share SAX index slipping 0.51 points to 221.8.

Gas storage firm Nafta and steel maker VSZ both gained, rising 40 crowns to 2,020 and nine crowns to 660 respectively, but failed to prevent the index's decline as bank VUB dropped 100 crowns to close at 2,000.
"The market has no singular trend," said Vladimir Kuklis, an analyst with CSOB Bank in Bratislava.

"Quite logically, VUB and VUB Kupon Fund should cool off and head downward after being too hot for so long, while recently forgotten VSZ and pharmaceuticals Biotika should start to rise," Kuklis added.
VUB Kupon closed down 85 crowns at 715.
Overall volume dropped to 103,258 shares traded on Monday from 348,705 shares on Friday, as turnover fell to 154.12 million crowns from 231.76 million.
